controller.management

Class RoomController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.PersistenceController
      • controller.EntityController<Room>
        • controller.management.RoomController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller

    public class RoomController
extends EntityController<Room>
    A controller responsible for managing Room entity.
    Author:
    Yijie

        rtController - - The RoomType EntityController to allow RoomController to interact with for information sharing.

    • Method Detail

      • getEntityName

        protected java.lang.String getEntityName()
        Description copied from class: EntityController
        Gets the entity name of the entity managed by this Controller instance. This entity name will be used to display the available options.
        For example, if entity name is "Guest Profile"
        The following options will be displayed for user to select:
        1. Create guest profile
        2. Retrieve/Search guest profile
        3. Update guest profile
        4. Delete guest profile
        Specified by:
        getEntityName in class EntityController<Room>
        Returns:
        The name to be displayed.

      • getOptions

        Callback method to notify the View of the available options for this controller.
        Specified by:
        getOptions in interface Controller
        Overrides:
        getOptions in class EntityController<Room>
        Returns:

      • safeOnOptionSelected

        protected void safeOnOptionSelected(View view,
                        int option)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: PersistenceController
        Subclasses of PersistenceController should implement this method instead of PersistenceController.onOptionSelected(View, int). For more information of what is to be implemented, please refer to Controller.onOptionSelected(View, int)
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

        option - - The option that is selected, the option value starts from 0.
